<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/robinhood-newest-memestock?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Meme Stock Is Born
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/robinhood-newest-memestock?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Robinhood illustration " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTI3L3JvYmluaG9vZF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The trading app Robinhood is known for powering the rise of so-called meme stocks—such as GameStop and AMC—that skyrocketed earlier this year, not necessarily because of business fundamentals, but because social media users found them to be amusing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even before its IPO last week, investors were wondering: Will Robinhood <em>itself</em> be a meme stock? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So far, the answer <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/04/robinhood-surges-another-13percent-a-day-after-jumping-past-ipo-price.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">appears to be yes</a>. After taking a dip on its first day of trading, Robinhood’s stock has shot up 100% this week, including a 50% gain yesterday. Trading was so vociferous that the stock had to be halted several times yesterday morning for Wall Street to catch its breath. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Are retail investors behind the surge? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the second time in this story, the answer appears to be yes. Here’s some evidence:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Total retail volume for Robinhood increased </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-04/robinhood-retail-traders-join-cathie-wood-to-get-stock-above-ipo?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about 10x</a></span><span> on Tuesday from the previous day.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Robinhood was the No. 1 stock mentioned on Reddit’s WallStreetBets forum, and was also the most traded stock on Fidelity.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Buy orders for Robinhood have nearly doubled those for another meme stock, AMC.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Another factor: </strong>This week, traders could start <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-stock-price-jumps-as-options-trading-begins-11628089785?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">placing options</a> on Robinhood’s stock, which allows investors to speculate on whether a stock will go up or down rather than buying actual equity in the company. Increased options activity has been a hallmark of meme stock mania, and accounted for <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/robinhood-ipo-options-trading-revenue-echoes-munger-gambling-comments-hood-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=In%202020%2C%20Robinhood%20generated%20%24958,market%20trading%20by%20retail%20investors." target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">46% of Robinhood’s revenue</a> in 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There might be some method to the madness: </strong>Cathie Wood’s investment firm ARK Invest, which has placed bullish bets on Tesla and other high-growth tech companies, increased its position in Robinhood on Tuesday. Analysts think retail traders could be taking their cue from their stock oracle, Cathie.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Robinhood will ride or die with individual traders...in more ways than one. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/spikes-covid-cases-among-children-officials-worried-backtoschool?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Covid Sidesteps Parental Controls
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/spikes-covid-cases-among-children-officials-worried-backtoschool?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='"How do you do, fellow kids?" meme with Covid virus as Steve Buscemi' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MDkyL2NvdmlkX2tpZHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, almost <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/03/us/covid-19-children-teens/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">72,000 children</a> under the age of 18 were infected with Covid-19, an 84% jump from the previous week, per the American Academy of Pediatrics. As kids head back to school to learn whatever the newest kind of division is, everyone from the <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/566272-arkansas-governor-says-he-regrets-signing-ban-on-mask-mandates?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Arkansas governor</a> to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/2021/08/04/pediatrician-covid-children-delta/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pediatric experts</a> is worried about keeping them safe.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s what we know about kids and the virus:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Roughly 10.9 million of the 25 million US children aged 12–17 have been at least partially vaccinated, per the CDC.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Kids under the age of 12 are not yet eligible for any of the vaccines authorized in the US. Current trials for young kids won’t finish up until late fall, well after school has started.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some states, like Florida, have reported a </span><span><a href="https://www.wfla.com/news/back-to-school-warning-local-doctors-see-spike-covid-19-cases-among-children/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surge</a></span><span> in serious cases among younger patients. But severe illness from Covid is still pretty rare among children, making up about 1.3%–3.5% of hospitalizations during the pandemic.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Dr. Fauci said that by Q1 2022 we’ll have enough data to begin vaccinating kids of all ages.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GIG ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/uber-lyft-back-new-gig-worker-ballot-proposal-massachusetts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber, Lyft Bring a Little Cali to Massachusetts
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re talking labor fights, not tacos, unfortunately.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A coalition of gig economy companies including Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, and Instacart <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/04/business/economy-stock-market-news?utm_source=morning_brew#gig-workers-massachusetts" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed a ballot proposal</a> that would keep their drivers classified as “independent contractors” rather than “employees.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That means gig workers in MA <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/group-backed-by-uber-lyft-pushes-massachusetts-gig-worker-ballot-measure-2021-08-04/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wouldn’t be entitled</a> to minimum wage, overtime, paid sick days, and other standard employee benefits. However, the proposal fills in some of those gaps, promising pre-tip rates of $18 per hour, earned sick days, and more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Opponents don't think extra toppings make up for sub-par froyo. “It’s going to take away [gig companies’] responsibilities under Massachusetts law and substitute these fake benefits,” labor attorney Shannon Liss-Riordan told the NYT.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This is basically a rerun of <em>The OC</em>
</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gig economies backed a similar measure, Prop 22, in California last year. It passed after the companies spent more than $205 million promoting it—a record sum for a California ballot measure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Big Gig has set up lobbying groups in five additional states in the last few months to challenge worker reclassification attempts that threaten their business models.<br><br></p>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/key-performance-indicators-august-5?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Rihanna at a Fenty fashion event at Bergdorf Goodman's " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80MDE3L3JpaGFubmFfZmVudHlfZmFzaGlvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Rihanna is officially a billionaire, according to Forbes, and the richest female musician in the world. But only a small percentage of <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/maddieberg/2021/08/04/fentys-fortune-rihanna-is-now-officially-a-billionaire/?sh=175d86f7c96b" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">her $1.7 billion fortune</a> can be attributed to your 16,000 plays of “SOS.” An estimated $1.4 billion comes from her makeup company, Fenty Beauty, and $270 million from Savage x Fenty, her lingerie brand. Maybe that’s why she’s in no rush to release R9...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Video killed the radio star.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">40 years ago this week, MTV debuted with the iconic hook by The Buggles. Here’s a video of the <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PJtiPRDIqtI" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first two hours</a> of the network, which includes some incredible music.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Beauty and solace in the abandoned worlds of Roblox. (<a href="https://pioneerworks.org/broadcast/i-know-a-place-pipkin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pioneer Works</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/heck-olympic-track-stars-setting-smashing-world-records?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
She’s a Runner, She’s a Track World Record Holder
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/heck-olympic-track-stars-setting-smashing-world-records?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="TOKYO, JAPAN - AUGUST 03: Karsten Warholm of Team Norway ran a new world..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MDkzL2F0aGxldGljc18tX29seW1waWNzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gallo Images/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Olympic track stars are running like they’re members of the Cullen family, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/2020-tokyo-olympics-elaine-thompson-track-and-field-dalilah-muhammad-technology-b9e92bd41a7dd218d942abccc2318079?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shattering</a> world records in Tokyo this week. Both the men’s and women’s 400m hurdles are considered among the best races ever run.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So is it the track? </strong>It’s definitely bouncy. Mondo, the track maker, took three years to develop it and finished installing the $1.5 million semi-vulcanized masterpiece in November 2019. The track <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/02/sports/olympics/Olympic-Stadium-fast-track-records.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mimics</a> the shock absorption of a trampoline, and running on it has been described by US sprinter Ronnie Baker as “like I’m walking on clouds.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Speaking of clouds: </strong>Some runners are lacing up their controversial <a href="https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/olympics/super-spikes-nike-warholm-tokyo-b1896014.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nike “super spikes,”</a> a super light shoe containing super responsive foam. Karsten Warholm, the Norwegian gold medalist and record holder in men’s 400m hurdles, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2021/aug/03/karsten-warholm-slams-super-spikes-as-threat-to-track-and-field-credibility?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called BS</a> when his opponent Rai Benjamin of the US, who received silver and also broke the previous world record, used the shoes this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> While the Olympics represent the best of the best, the athletes <em>are</em> running on the right track at the right time with the right shoes.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Video may have killed the radio star, but it did not kill crosswords. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/04/brew-mini-dot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play our Mini here</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is as fake as a Dior bag on Canal Street. Can you guess the odd one out? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Tech-forward Domino's plans to </span><span><a href="https://media0.giphy.com/media/jqSYQiB3ZvcxgQrGbb/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47ufdoglyirxaagwbit28jzoxb0mv8sb9kqn8omz4b&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launch</a></span><span> "'Pizza Metaverse'"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Visitors to US Titanic museum </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2021/aug/04/three-injured-as-iceberg-wall-collapses-at-us-titanic-museum?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">injured</a></span><span> by replica iceberg"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Hog heaven: China </span><span><a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2021/8/2/hog-heaven-china-builds-pig-hotels-for-better-biosecurity?utm_source=Eurasia+Group+Signal&utm_campaign=cc04e0dec7-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2021_08_04_11_04&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e605619869-cc04e0dec7-170222949" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">builds</a></span><span> pig hotels for better biosecurity"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"When a shower door </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/used-renters-insurance-to-pay-off-student-loans-2021-8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sliced</a></span><span> my hands open, I used $23,000 from renters insurance to pay off my student loans—and now I'm debt-free"</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>

</th>
</tr>

src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTI3L3JvYmluaG9vZF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe trading app Robinhood is known for powering the rise of so-called meme stocks—such as GameStop and AMC—that skyrocketed earlier this year, not necessarily because of business fundamentals, but because social media users found them to be amusing.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven before its IPO last week, investors were wondering: Will Robinhood \u003cem\u003eitself\u003c/em\u003e be a meme stock? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo far, the answer \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/04/robinhood-surges-another-13percent-a-day-after-jumping-past-ipo-price.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eappears to be yes\u003c/a\u003e. After taking a dip on its first day of trading, Robinhood’s stock has shot up 100% this week, including a 50% gain yesterday. Trading was so vociferous that the stock had to be halted several times yesterday morning for Wall Street to catch its breath. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAre retail investors behind the surge? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the second time in this story, the answer appears to be yes. Here’s some evidence:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTotal retail volume for Robinhood increased \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-04/robinhood-retail-traders-join-cathie-wood-to-get-stock-above-ipo?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout 10x\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Tuesday from the previous day.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRobinhood was the No. 1 stock mentioned on Reddit’s WallStreetBets forum, and was also the most traded stock on Fidelity.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBuy orders for Robinhood have nearly doubled those for another meme stock, AMC.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother factor: \u003c/strong\u003eThis week, traders could start \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-stock-price-jumps-as-options-trading-begins-11628089785?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplacing options\u003c/a\u003e on Robinhood’s stock, which allows investors to speculate on whether a stock will go up or down rather than buying actual equity in the company. Increased options activity has been a hallmark of meme stock mania, and accounted for \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/robinhood-ipo-options-trading-revenue-echoes-munger-gambling-comments-hood-2021-7?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=In%202020%2C%20Robinhood%20generated%20%24958,market%20trading%20by%20retail%20investors.\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e46% of Robinhood’s revenue\u003c/a\u003e in 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere might be some method to the madness: \u003c/strong\u003eCathie Wood’s investment firm ARK Invest, which has placed bullish bets on Tesla and other high-growth tech companies, increased its position in Robinhood on Tuesday. Analysts think retail traders could be taking their cue from their stock oracle, Cathie.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eRobinhood will ride or die with individual traders...in more ways than one. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, almost \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/03/us/covid-19-children-teens/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e72,000 children\u003c/a\u003e under the age of 18 were infected with Covid-19, an 84% jump from the previous week, per the American Academy of Pediatrics. As kids head back to school to learn whatever the newest kind of division is, everyone from the \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/state-watch/566272-arkansas-governor-says-he-regrets-signing-ban-on-mask-mandates?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eArkansas governor\u003c/a\u003e to \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/2021/08/04/pediatrician-covid-children-delta/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epediatric experts\u003c/a\u003e is worried about keeping them safe.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere’s what we know about kids and the virus:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRoughly 10.9 million of the 25 million US children aged 12–17 have been at least partially vaccinated, per the CDC.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKids under the age of 12 are not yet eligible for any of the vaccines authorized in the US. Current trials for young kids won’t finish up until late fall, well after school has started.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome states, like Florida, have reported a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wfla.com/news/back-to-school-warning-local-doctors-see-spike-covid-19-cases-among-children/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurge\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in serious cases among younger patients. But severe illness from Covid is still pretty rare among children, making up about 1.3%–3.5% of hospitalizations during the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re talking labor fights, not tacos, unfortunately.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA coalition of gig economy companies including Uber, Lyft, DoorDash, and Instacart \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/04/business/economy-stock-market-news?utm_source=morning_brew#gig-workers-massachusetts\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled a ballot proposal\u003c/a\u003e that would keep their drivers classified as “independent contractors” rather than “employees.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat means gig workers in MA \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/group-backed-by-uber-lyft-pushes-massachusetts-gig-worker-ballot-measure-2021-08-04/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewouldn’t be entitled\u003c/a\u003e to minimum wage, overtime, paid sick days, and other standard employee benefits. However, the proposal fills in some of those gaps, promising pre-tip rates of $18 per hour, earned sick days, and more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOpponents don't think extra toppings make up for sub-par froyo. “It’s going to take away [gig companies’] responsibilities under Massachusetts law and substitute these fake benefits,” labor attorney Shannon Liss-Riordan told the NYT.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis is basically a rerun of \u003cem\u003eThe OC\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGig economies backed a similar measure, Prop 22, in California last year. It passed after the companies spent more than $205 million promoting it—a record sum for a California ballot measure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBig Gig has set up lobbying groups in five additional states in the last few months to challenge worker reclassification attempts that threaten their business models.\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable The track \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/02/sports/olympics/Olympic-Stadium-fast-track-records.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emimics\u003c/a\u003e the shock absorption of a trampoline, and running on it has been described by US sprinter Ronnie Baker as “like I’m walking on clouds.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpeaking of clouds: \u003c/strong\u003eSome runners are lacing up their controversial \u003ca href=\"https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/olympics/super-spikes-nike-warholm-tokyo-b1896014.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNike “super spikes,”\u003c/a\u003e a super light shoe containing super responsive foam. Karsten Warholm, the Norwegian gold medalist and record holder in men’s 400m hurdles, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2021/aug/03/karsten-warholm-slams-super-spikes-as-threat-to-track-and-field-credibility?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\"
